page.title: 20Transport
page.content: The London_Lowestoft railway line runs through the Fynn Valley but the only station, at Bealings, is closed but not demolished. The unmanned level crossing beside the station causes concern locally as an accident occurred recently. In this part of the country there is general concern about this type of unmanned crossing which causes fatalities. Nearest railway stations are at Woodbridge, or Ipswich on main London-Norwich line. The bus service has been provided for many years by a private company, up to five buses daily to or from Ipswich for each village.The commuting population travels by car and many families have two cars, one for enabling children to be taken to school. Minor roads are hedged and narrow, causing concern about the risk from fast commuter traffic.
